greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle giving number of nonisomorphic minimal covering designs with parameters (n, k, k-1) (designs achieving the covering number C(n,k,k-1) given in A066010), for n >= 2, 2 <= k <= n.
comment: C(v,k,t) is the smallest number of k-subsets of an n-set such that every t-subset is contained in at least one of the k-subsets. This sequence says how many different solutions there are for C(n,k,k-1).
reference: CRC Handbook of Combinatorial Designs, 1996, p. 263.
W. H. Mills and R. C. Mullin, Coverings and packings, pp. 371-399 of Jeffrey H. Dinitz and D. R. Stinson, editors, Contemporary Design Theory, Wiley, 1992.
link: D. Applegate, E. M. Rains and N. J. A. Sloane, On asymmetric coverings and covering numbers, J. Comb. Des. 11 (2003), 218-228.
D. Gordon, La Jolla Repository of Coverings
K. J. Nurmela and Patric R. J. Östergård, New coverings of t-sets with (t+1)-sets, J. Combinat. Designs, 7 (1999), 217-226.
K. J. Nurmela and Patric R. J. Östergård, New coverings of t-sets with (t+1)-sets (appendix), J. Combinat. Designs, 7 (1999), 217-226.
Index entries for sequences related to Steiner systems
xref: Cf. A066010. A030129 gives entries in second column in the cases when a Steiner triple system exists.
A051390 gives entries in 3rd column in the cases when a Steiner quadruple system exists.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 11 2002
